intro: Doria perornata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow and purple, which bloom in clusters. Doria perornata is native to regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, warm climates. It is often found in moist lowland areas and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
